Each scenario emphasizes:  
- **Capacity**: Explicit vehicle load limits (C)  
- **Mixed Backhauls**: Flexible delivery/pickup sequencing (MB)  
- **Duration Limits**: Hard route time/distance caps (L)  
- **Time Windows**: Service time constraints (TW)  

The descriptions avoid open routes and strict backhaul sequencing while highlighting industry-specific nuances like cold chain logistics, VIP service protocols, and polar expedition constraints.

desc_split: A movie production coordinates simultaneous delivery of perishable meals (<demand_linehaul>) and collection of period props (<demand_backhaul>) to shooting locations (<locs>). title: Mobile EV Battery Swapping & Degraded Battery Collection with Time-Sensitive Stops
desc_split: A fleet of mobile battery-swapping vans services electric vehicle owners who request on-demand battery replacements. Time windows (<time_windows>) are strict due to customer appointments, and routes must finish within <time_limit> hours to ensure vans return for overnight recharging. Mixed backhauls allow prioritizing urgent swaps while collecting degraded batteries en route.
